com.st.st25sdk.type3

Class Type3Tag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.NFCTag
      • com.st.st25sdk.type3.Type3Tag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheInterface, NdefCommandInterface

    public class Type3Tag
extends NFCTag
implements CacheInterface, NdefCommandInterface
    Defines required methods to handle a NFC Forum Type3 tag

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Type3Tag.Type3FileType
      Lists existing Type3 file types

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      protected int mChecksum 
      protected int mLn 
      protected byte[] mManufacturerId 
      protected byte mNbr 
      protected byte mNbw 
      protected NdefType3Command mNdefCmd 
      protected int mNMaxB 
      protected byte mRWFlag 
      protected Type3Command mType3Cmd 
      protected byte mVer 
      protected byte mWriteFlag 
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_BLOCK_ADDRESS
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_CHECKSUM_ADDRESS_IN_BYTE
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag 'Checksum' 'Checksum' : allows the RF reader/writer to check whether the Attribute Data are correct(2 bytes)
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_LN_ADDRESS_IN_BYTE
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag 'Ln' 'Ln' : size of the actual stored NDEF data in bytes (3 bytes)
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_NBR_ADDRESS_IN_BYTE
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag 'Nbr' 'Nbr' : number of blocks that can be read using one CHECK command
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_NBW_ADDRESS_IN_BYTE
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag 'Nbw' 'Nbw' : number of blocks that can be written using one UPDATE command
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_NMAXB_ADDRESS_IN_BYTE
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag 'NmaxB' 'NmaxB' : indicates the maximum number of blocks available for NDEF data (2 bytes)
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_RWFLAG_ADDRESS_IN_BYTE
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag 'RWFlag' 'RWFlag' : indicates whether the NDEF on the Type3 Tag can be updated (read write : 0x00) or not (read only : 0x01)
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_VER_ADDRESS_IN_BYTE
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag 'Ver' 'Ver' = NDEF mapping version
      static int T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_WRITEFLAG_ADDRESS_IN_BYTE
      Address in block 0 (Attribute information) of the T3T tag 'WriteFlag' 'WriteFlag' : indicates whether a previous NDE write procedure has finished (0x00) or not (0x0F)
      static byte T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_WRITEFLAG_PROCEDURE_FINISHED
      Write procedure finished value for WriteFlage
      static byte T3T_ATTRIBUTE_INFO_WRITEFLAG_PROCEDURE_NOT_FINISHED
      Write procedure not finished value for WriteFlage
      static int T3T_NDEF_FIRST_BLOCK_NUMBER
      Address of the first block reserved for NDEF message
      static int T3T_NDEF_FIRST_BYTE_ADDRESS
      Address of the first byte reserved for NDEF message

                        int sizeInBytes)
                 throws STException
        Description copied from class: NFCTag
        Read a number of Bytes at a given address In case of read error, the STException will contain the data that we have been able to read. Use e.getErrorData() to retrieve them.

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(int byteAddress,
                       byte[] data)
                throws STException
        Description copied from class: NFCTag
        Write some Bytes at a given address WARNING: After this write, the cache may not be aligned anymore with tag's memory content so it is recommended to invalidate the cache.
        Specified by:
        writeBytes in class NFCTag
        Parameters:
        byteAddress - First address to be written
        data - Data to be written
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeNdefMessage

        public void writeNdefMessage(NDEFMsg msg)
                      throws STException
        Write a NDEF message with specified flags.
        Specified by:
        writeNdefMessage in interface NdefCommandInterface
        Specified by:
        writeNdefMessage in class NFCTag
        Parameters:
        msg - NDEF Message to write, must not be null
        Throws:
        STException - - STExceptionCode.INVALID_DATA_PARAM if msg parameter is null - STExceptionCode.INVALID_CCFILE if the CCFile does not follow the ISO rules - STExceptionCode.INVALID_NDEF_DATA if the NDEF data fields are not formatted correctly - STExceptionCode.NDEF_MESSAGE_TOO_BIG if the message length does not fit in the tag's memory
